facts: Dogs have three eyelids, including a nictitating membrane that keeps their eyes moist and protected.
A dog's sense of smell is 10,000 to 100,000 times more acute than humans.
Dogs can hear frequencies up to 65,000 Hz, while humans can only hear up to 20,000 Hz.
The Basenji dog breed is unique because it doesn't bark, but instead makes a yodeling sound.
Dogs sweat through the pads of their feet rather than through their skin.
A dog's nose print is as unique as a human's fingerprint and can be used for identification.
Puppies are born deaf, blind, and toothless, relying entirely on their mother initially.
Dogs have about 1,700 taste buds, far fewer than humans who have approximately 9,000.
The fastest dog breed, the Greyhound, can reach speeds of up to 45 miles per hour.
Dogs can understand up to 250 words and gestures, similar to a two-year-old child.
The oldest known dog lived to be 29 years old, an Australian Cattle Dog named Bluey.
Dogs dream similarly to humans, often moving their legs and making sounds during REM sleep.
A dog's sense of time is impressive; they can predict when their owners will return home.
The Newfoundland breed has webbed feet, making them excellent swimmers.
Dogs have been domesticated for over 15,000 years, longer than any other animal.
A dog's heart rate is 60-140 beats per minute, varying by size and breed.
Dogs can be trained to detect diseases like cancer and diabetes through scent.
The tallest dog breed, the Irish Wolfhound, can stand over 7 feet tall on its hind legs.
Dogs have 18 muscles controlling their ears, allowing precise ear movement.
The world's smallest dog breed is the Chihuahua, weighing as little as 2 pounds.
